description:

description:
On April 17th, it is announced that the Ministry of Education in Guatemala has established strategy points for college students' education post-quarantine:
1) Making a diagnostic evaluation of the students at the time of resuming the school year, to find out how much knowledge they managed to achieve during the quarantine
2) Evaluations will take place to evaluate competencies and skills, not content
3) The school term will be extended to compensate for the missed class time
4) The ministry will establish what learning is the most essential and fundamental for the student to acquire and ask schools to focus on it.

description: On the 14th of June, Guatemala announces new restrictions on the circulation of vehicles depending on license plate numbers in the departments of Sacatepquez, El Progreso and San Marcos. "On Tuesday, the plates whose numbering ends in even numbers: 0, 2, 4, 6 and 8 are in circulation. On Wednesday, the plates whose numbering ends in odd numbers are in circulation: 1, 3, 5, 7 and 9." And so on for the rest of the week, until the Sunday which is a complete lockdown apart from specified exemptions.These measures are set to last until at least June 28th.

The restriction will apply to the following departments: Guatemala, Sacatepquez, Escuintla, and Quetzaltenango - but NOT San Marcos and El Progreso as before.
